name: Regeneron International Science and Engineering Fair (ISEF)
description: The world's largest international pre-college science competition, where students present their independent research projects.
deadline: Varies by affiliated fair, typically Nov-Jan

name: Regeneron Science Talent Search (STS)
description: The United States' most prestigious and oldest science and math research competition for high school seniors.

name: International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO)
description: The world championship mathematics competition for high school students, held annually in a different country.

name: International Physics Olympiad (IPhO)
description: An annual international physics competition for secondary school students.

name: International Chemistry Olympiad (IChO)
description: An annual academic competition for high school students, testing their chemistry knowledge and skills.

name: International Biology Olympiad (IBO)
description: The world's premier science olympiad for high school students, testing practical and theoretical biology skills.

name: International Olympiad in Informatics (IOI)
description: One of the most prestigious computer science competitions in the world for secondary school students.

name: FIRST Robotics Competition
description: An international robotics competition where high school teams design, build, and program robots to compete in a themed game.
location: Multiple Regional Events; Championship in USA

name: Google Science Fair
description: A defunct global online science and engineering competition that encouraged teenagers to solve real-world problems using science, technology, engineering, and math.

name: Microsoft Imagine Cup
description: A global technology competition for students, where they create innovative applications, games, and solutions.
deadline: Varies, typically early in the year

name: Conrad Challenge
description: An annual, multi-phase innovation and entrepreneurial competition that encourages students to develop solutions to global problems.

name: Davidson Fellows Scholarship
description: A scholarship program that awards students 18 or under who have completed a significant piece of work.

name: Breakthrough Junior Challenge
description: A global science video competition where students explain a big idea in physics, life sciences, or mathematics in an engaging way.

name: National Science Bowl
description: A nationwide academic competition in the U.S. that tests students' knowledge in all areas of science and mathematics.

name: Science Olympiad
description: A nationwide team-based science competition where students compete in 23 events covering various scientific disciplines.
column10: Varies by state; National tournament location varies

name: VEX Robotics Competition
description: The world's largest robotics competition for students from elementary to university levels.
column13: and national events; World Championship in USA

name: F1 in Schools
description: A global STEM competition where students design, manufacture, test, and race miniature F1 cars.

name: Shell Eco-marathon
description: A global engineering competition that challenges students to design, build, and drive the most energy-efficient vehicles.

name: Intel AI Global Impact Festival
description: A competition celebrating the next generation of technologists, innovators, and leaders, and empowering them with AI-ready skills.

name: NASA Human Exploration Rover Challenge
description: An annual engineering competition hosted by NASA that challenges high school and college students to design and build a human-powered rover.

name: Genes in Space
description: A competition to design pioneering DNA experiments that will be conducted on the International Space Station.

name: Stockholm Junior Water Prize
description: The most prestigious international award for a high school student's water research project.

name: Envirothon
description: North America's largest hands-on environmental and natural resource competition for high school students.

name: BioGENEius Challenge
description: The premier competition for high school student researchers in biotechnology.

name: Odyssey of the Mind
description: An international creative problem-solving program for students from kindergarten to college.

name: Destination Imagination
description: A global project-based, team-based program that teaches kids creative problem-solving skills.

name: Technovation Girls
description: A global program that invites teams of girls ages 10 to 18 to learn and apply the skills needed to solve real-world problems through technology.

name: e-CYBERMISSION
description: A free, web-based STEM competition for students in grades 6-9, where they propose a solution to a problem in their community.

name: 3M Young Scientist Challenge
description: America's premier science competition for middle school students (grades 5-8), encouraging scientific exploration.

name: Broadcom MASTERS
description: The premier U.S. science and engineering competition for middle school students.

name: CSIRO CREST Awards
description: A non-competitive program that supports students in carrying out their own self-directed science projects.

name: European Union Contest for Young Scientists (EUCYS)
description: An annual science competition of the European Union for young scientists.

name: China Adolescents Science & Technology Innovation Contest (CASTIC)
description: The largest and most prestigious science competition in China for young scientists.

name: International Young Physicists' Tournament (IYPT)
description: A team competition for secondary school students, where teams present and defend their solutions to open-ended physics problems.

name: International Astronomy and Astrophysics Competition
description: An international online science competition that allows students to showcase their talents and improve their astronomy knowledge.

name: International Environmental Project Olympiad (INEPO)
description: An international project competition focused on environmental issues, aiming to raise environmental awareness among young people.

name: Google Code Jam
description: A defunct international programming competition hosted by Google, where professional and amateur programmers solved complex algorithmic problems.

name: Topcoder Open
description: A premier programming and design tournament where top talent from around the world competes.

name: International Genetically Engineered Machine (iGEM) Competition
description: The world's premier synthetic biology competition for university and high school students.
deadline: Varies, team registration early in the year

name: RoboCup
description: An international robotics project to promote AI and robotics research and education.

name: World Robot Olympiad (WRO)
description: A global robotics competition for young people, where teams design and build robotic solutions to challenges.

name: FIRST LEGO League
description: Introduces elementary and middle school students to science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) concepts while building LEGO-based robots.
location: Multiple local and regional events; International championships

name: Team America Rocketry Challenge (TARC)
description: The world's largest rocket contest, where students design, build, and fly a rocket to meet specific criteria.

name: Solar Decathlon
description: A collegiate competition that challenges student teams to design and build high-performance, solar-powered buildings.
deadline: Varies by competition (e.g., Build Challenge, Design Challenge)

name: Engineers Without Borders Challenge
description: A unique design program for first-year university students, focused on sustainable and human-centered design.

name: James Dyson Award
description: An international design competition that celebrates, encourages, and inspires the next generation of design engineers.
age_range: Current or recent design or engineering students

name: Global Student Challenge
description: The largest student competition for supply chain management and finance.

name: International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC)
description: The oldest, largest, and most prestigious team-based programming contest in the world for university students.

name: Formula SAE
description: A student design competition for engineering students organized by SAE International.
location: Multiple events in USA and worldwide

name: International Brain Bee
description: A neuroscience competition for high school students, aiming to inspire them to pursue careers in neuroscience.
